page.title: 17Millow Hall Farm.
page.content: Millow Hall Farm lies in the hamlet of Millow which once had a public house called the Bell. This has now been demolished. Mr Kendal owns the farm in conjunction with three other members of his family. The farm has been in the family since 1898. The farm is 490 acres in size. Mr Kendal grows 200acres of wheat, 90 acres of barley, tick beans, oil seed rape, sprouts and peas. 30 acres of land are let to a horticulturalist. The tick beans are used for cattle feed, pigeon feed and exported to Germany for use in sausages. The produce is sold to Beds. Growers. The sprouts are mainly frozen and go to Sainsbury's supermarkets. The wheat is used for bread, biscuit flour and cattle feed. Sheep and cattle are also kept.
